column4: my laptop fan is constantly running at max speed. I don't know how to address this issue. can anyone help?
it's spotless and only a month old
i got the laptop when the model was released last month and it is on ubuntu's supported hardware
how do you know it's supported
the symptons you are showing is common with hardware that doesn't have supported powerscaling or thermal sensors
my laptop is the core i5 version
just reading the link, seeing if there is anything of interest
Standard images of Ubuntu may not work at all on the system....?
yes, did your laptop come with a pre-installed version of ubuntu
ok, so point 2 "standard images of ubuntu may not work well"
sigh so the answer is to go back to windows 7? hehe
I find that hardware page you've linked to just stupid to be honest, saying it's supported, but also may not work
how it is setting fan levels
I'd look at the themal info, see if it "thinks" it's hot, or if it knows it's cold, but just "wants" to run the fan
